The Collecting Passion Museum of American Folk Art, Columbus Avenue, at 65th Street; (212) 595-9533.

''An Engagement With Folk Art: Cyril I. Nelson's Gifts to the Museum of American Folk Art,'' an exhibition of more than 60 objects donated over two decades by a collector and museum trustee, opens on Saturday and runs through Jan. 7.
Half of the show is devoted to quilts and textiles like coverlets and blankets, and the other half to furniture, sculpture and portrait and landscape paintings.
The museum is open Tuesday through Sunday, 11:30 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. Free.
Design Underfoot Parsons Exhibition Gallery, Two West 13th Street; (212) 229-8987.

''The Floor Show,'' an exhibition of 20th-century floor design and materials, starts Wednesday and runs through Oct. 6. The show presents photographs and drawings of, among other things, wood parquet floors, ceramic tiles and rugs. Open Monday through Saturday, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. Free.
Craft Classes Craft Students League at the Y.W.C.A., 610 Lexington Avenue, at 53d Street; (212) 735-9731.

Fall courses in ceramics, painting, decorative finishes, jewelry making, woodworking and papermaking will start on Sept. 11. An open house will be held on Wednesday, from 5 to 7:30 p.m. A schedule is available by phone.
Garden Talks Old Westbury Gardens, 71 Old Westbury Road, between Long Island Expessway and Jericho Turnpike; (516) 333-0048.

Fall talk and tour subjects include choosing plants to attract butterflies, Sunday; growing African violets indoors, Sept. 9; fall chrysanthemums (a walk), Sept. 23; and the fireplaces of Old Westbury House, Sept. 30. The events, which start at 2 p.m., are free with garden admission: $8; for those 62 and older, $6; for those 6 to 12, $3. There is also a fee of $2 for Old Westbury House; $3 for those 6 to 12.
